Summary: This Marriott hotel has so many things going for it, yet falls short in several areas.   Pros:  -Location is fantastic for those traveling or staying for work. Right across the street from several good restaurants, movie theaters, and the freeway.  -Nice size rooms  -Reasonably priced  -Breakfast is free, but minimal.   Cons  -Heard the staff talking about the bottom floor rooms being broken into through the exterior windows.   -Dirty and outdated. Stains on the carpets in hallways and rooms and our couch  -Asked twice for cleaning wipes for the gym on two different days and they never replenished them. Nothing to wipe down the equipment.  -Mattress in room was old and lumpy.   -Water pressure was low  -Pay to park in an area where I saw people doing drugs in their cars on the
Room tip: Choose a top floor room for safety

Summary: Excellent family hotel, modern, clean, friendly staff. We stayed here for 5 days as a base to explore the local area. Our room was very clean, comfy beds and cleaned thoroughly each day. The breakfast is ok- not bad for a free one. Lovely staff, can highly recommend!

Summary Heading: A stay which could’ve been better.
Summary: A nice hotel with a few downfalls.   Parking is $10 dollars a night which is totally unnecessary.   The shower pressure is TERRIBLE - this was noted at checkout so I hope this has been resolved for the next guest in our room.   Our room over looked the games balcony which meant we could never have the blinds open.   Now for my main issue. Our credit card was charged not once but twice for the full amount of our stay (nearly $1800) despite being paid in full before our stay. This was done on check in and then again on check out. This is totally unacceptable and I will be taking this complaint further. First time it was done it was rectified within a few days but we checked 5 days ago and still no contact from the hotel with our refund. We booked through British Airways so anyone

My significant other also posted my review on the Marriott web-site, but I put some more details here.   First things first I always assess shower pressure:  No shower pressure or consistent toilet flushing, so you will have hair stuck to your body when you shower.  It won't be a problem if you have short hair. I've had worse water pressure before, so this shower isn't a deal breaker.  This wasn't the worst, but just not as good as Fairfield or Residence Inn showers, for reference.   Just go here if you are not planning to shower or if you are a solo traveler who doesn't need to flush the toilet right away.  They work, but you need to wait, kind of like on a cruise ship...plumbing issues. Also, take your own hair-dryer.   There were crumbs on the sofa upon entry to my room, in a
Room tip: Construction during April in back of building beginning at 7AM. Yes, It will wake you up so take...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. I have shared your feedback with the leadership team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place.

Summary Heading: No shower pressure and incorrect plumbing hookups
Summary: The blue dot gave hot water and the red dot gave cold water on the sink faucet so the plumber hooked up the sink faucet backwards.  Room 305 if anyone wants to fix it. The shower was unreal.  We could not get clean. Horrible to no pressure at all.
Room tip: If plumbing is important to you....stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. I have shared your feedback with our hotel's leadership team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place and reviewed to prevent what you experienced from occurring in the future.  Thank you for your loyalty and for choosing Marriott.

Summary Heading: Terrible Example of a Marriott Brandy
Summary: We selected this location because it was nearby to a family gathering. We thought it would be a great place because it is a Marriott and it is a pretty new property. First, when we checked in we were told there was a $10 charge to park, of which we were previously unaware. There’s no security provided in the parking lot. It is self-serve. Not sure why the $10 fee was needed. Also, the front doors to the hotel were not working, so we were instructed about the location of side doors. We found this to be a safety concern, as we have been awoken in hotels before, when the building had to be evacuated through the front lobby. On to the sanitation… Right outside the elevator on our room floor, there was a large dark stain in the carpet, as though someone had been sick there. Not sure
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience while staying with us. Your experience of with our hotel front desk team members is below our standard.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and I sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. I have shared your feedback with our hotel's leadership team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place and reviewed to prevent what you experienced from occurring in the future.  Thank you for your loyalty and for choosing Marriott.

Summary: Overall, this is a good hotel to stay in for the area. It is not too close to the freeway or the busy street of Beach Blvd. It is upwind from the freeway and so you can breathe a little bit easier. Directly across the street is Whole Foods supermarket and Bella Terra, a shopping and dining complex which consists of California Pizza Kitchen, Cheese Cake Factory, Island Burgers, Jamba Juice, Somi Somi, Jamba Juice, and a whole bunch of stuff. There’s also REI if you need camping gear and a movie theater too. If you want Vietnamese noodle soup, there are two of the best noodle shops in Orange County within walking distance: they are Silk Noodle Bar (they make their noodles fresh and their filet mignon pho is out of this world. You can add other meats like meatballs to it if you
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire hotel team, I want to thank you for staying with us.  It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback, particularly when it comes from those who matter the most – you! Your feedback has been shared with the team as a way of celebrating the great guest experiences we delivered. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.  We hope to welcome you again soon.  Springhill Suites Huntington Beach Hotel Team.

Summary: Great location, really pleasant and clean rooms, but the thing that makes this such a good place to stay are the staff. All of the people are incredibly helpful and generous with their time and advice. We travelled with my two kids 2 years old and 6 months old, we enjoyed the location near LA
Manager Response: On behalf of the entire hotel team, I want to thank you for staying with us.  It is always encouraging to hear positive feedback, particularly when it comes from those who matter the most – you! Your feedback has been shared with the team as a way of celebrating the great guest experiences we delivered. Once again, I appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.  We hope to welcome you again soon.  Springhill Suites Huntington Beach Hotel Team.

Summary: I have never stayed a hotel property where you paid for handicap parking! I realize that services were reduced and/or suspened because of covid but to try and make up for this shortfall by charging handicapped people for parking is over the top. Will not be staying here again.

It’s a cool hotel! Really liked how the parking was complementary for all guests.  I was pretty bummed that the terrace because I wanted to use the connect 4 but was closed but oh Wells! Yuni the GM was excellent! Big shout out to her!

Stayed for work and a great weekend. Enjoyed the free breakfast each morning. Rooms are large with great work desk. Staff was helpful and housekeeping did a great job cleaning. Great rate for being in a beach town

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our family's extended vacation
Summary: Springhill Suite HB was the perfect choice for our family. We stayed in the hotel for a total of 17 days during our extended US vacation which may give us a unique perspective of the hotel. Basically, the hotel met all the needs of our family's unique travel itinerary. In fact, we were convinced that any future trips to revisit the area will always find our family staying here.  The benefits of the hotel from our family's perspective:  (1) The Front Desk team - I only recall Jake's name - but they were all helpful and accommodating during check-in and check out or whenever we had any questions or requests.  (2) The Location - across Bella Terra which has a Whole Foods, Staples, Kohls, Old Navy, Cheesecake Factory, REI, etc. were convenient; similarly there's a Target and Walmart

This must be a newer hotel. It sure is nice. I enjoyed my room with a very large television and the separate sitting area.  Lobby is spacious and free breakfast!  Plenty of parking too.  Room has a microwave and refrigerator.
Manager Response: Dwane M,   Thank you for the great review of the SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach. I am glad you had a great visit with us.   Our Studio suites are 25% larger then traditional hotel rooms, and as you noted, the added amenities.  I look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: Spent just one night here. The hotel is very nice and well maintained.  Unfortunately, a truck and trailer took up 5 spots, so I ended up having to park on the street. The hotel was accommodating, however, and promised to reimburse the parking fee. Breakfast is included and is fabulous!  All kinds of hot and cold choices plus various beverages. Location is great - near shopping, restaurants and just a few miles from beautiful Huntington Beach.  I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Debra D  Thank you for your recent stay with us. I am glad the front desk helped with the parking issue and you had a great overall stay with us.    I look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: Spent four nights here during a business trip.  Hotel is clean, well maintained and the staff is very helpful.  The room was comfortable and well appointed. There is good shopping and great restaurants in walking distance from the hotel.
Manager Response: RJ J,  Thank you for your recent stay with us at the SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach. I am glad you had a great 4 day stay with us and had a chance to visit Bella Terra across from the hotel.  The positive comments about the hotel staff is much appriciated.  I look forward to your next visit to Huntington Beach

Summary: Hall, elevator, and rooms smelled of marijuana. EV charging available, however, staff did not enforce EV parking so spots were blocked by ICE vehicles. I tried to enforce a parking spot as I was leaving, but the person said she worked there and parked her ICE vehicle anyway.
Manager Response: Hello Cdasunci,    Thank you for taking the time to share with us about your recent experience. We value and appreciate your feedback as it helps us to focus on what is important to our guests. It is disappointing to read that your recent experience fell short of your expectations due to the unavailability of EV parking spaces. Please accept our sincere apologies for the disappointment you experienced. Making sure all of our guests experience an amazing time when visiting is one of our top priorities. We will make sure to review our universal brand standards and policies with our team to ensure a consistent level of service is being delivered through out the hotel. This will help if in the future any of the EV stations are being used improperly. Once again, thank you for your valuable feedback. We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to the Huntington Beach area.

Summary: At check-in the man was gracious and welcoming. He surprised us by saying he would make parking complimentary. We thanked him so much. Then we were indeed billed for parking. The room was fine except that the bathroom is in the middle and has a wide privacy glass door that lights up the whole room, not a positive at night. The breakfast was poor and the kitchen person argued that the cheese was fresh despite visible mold. The final price was higher than the pre-agreed price (no reply to my contacts to the manager and copies of the documents) AND they did charge for parking for every night.  We will never be back, and will look askance at the chain in general.
Manager Response: Hello illinoistraveler2016,  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. The entire staff would like to apologize for the inconvenience the lighting from the bathroom may have caused to yourself and your fellow travelers. We're also deeply sorry for the poor breakfast experience you encountered and will be revisiting our training standards with our breakfast attendants to ensure they are offering only the best quality breakfast items to our guests. Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Huntington Beach.  Thank you

Summary: We stopped going to Marriott properties for a year because of this location. The room had peanut shells in a corner (mind you we had a child that was allergic to peanuts with us)—thank God we caught it. There was candy gummies in the hall with ants all over it. Our sheets had blood like stains on it...we told them and they didn’t change it. They just flipped it over hoping we wouldn’t notice. Then they charged us twice for no reason. Took 8 months to refund.  A year later, they are manipulating our rates to get commission and honestly it’s because my poor mother had an accent. Thankfully I caught the error.   Customer explicitly YELLED at me “ we’re not dealing with this, go to Hilton”. Which you know what...is a much better idea! Never coming back.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear about your stay from a year ago. As for the current reservation and rates, the changes occurred due to the dates of arrival changed as well as the room type you requested. Our staff was trying to work with your mother, but clearly you felt as we did not just say yes, it was because of your mother accent, which when I spoke with her, was minimal, and not an issue to clearly understand her.   I did follow up with customer care, in which you state you would be staying at another brand, not what the customer service person said, when they tried to help you.   Again, I am sorry we have not been able to meet your needs, and hope you can find a location that can better accommodate you.  Sincerely

Summary: We stayed in this hotel and right away I knew it was not going to be a typical Marriott. I am a Platinum Elite member and I am usually treated like a queen. This was like I was the peasant girl in town. Everything I requested such as water and late checkout was denied. The people at the front desk made me feel like I was asking for the moon. I asked to check out an hour after checkout, which several hours after is a perk of Platinum membership, and was told no. They were busy and short staffed and no can do. Really??  I asked for water and they wanted to charge me. I have NEVER paid for water with my membership. Sorry SpringHill, you are not a Marriott in my book. Love Marriott and never have been treated like this anywhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Nikki Z  Dear Mr. Clinton,   Thank you for choosing to stay at the SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach Orange County and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey. Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. I will follow up with my front desk staff, to make sure that we do recognize our most loyal guests with Marriott and are offering the amenities our guests deserve. We like to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding guest experience especially our loyalty base members. Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Huntington Beach.  Best regards

Summary Heading: Dean at Check In was Great!
Summary: Stayed here for one night after the holiday weekend and headed south to SD. This is a Cool select service property. Up to date and Dean was very informative at arrival. Had plenty of space in the suite for my wife and baby with all their stuff :)

Upon arrival, excellent greetings from the front desk staff, Free WiFi, clean lobby and bar area. 2nd Floor has an outdoor seating area excellent for lounging and relaxing. Upon checking in to the room the set up was different, had the tv catty cornered away from the bed, however the large screen more than makes up for the position. Hands down 5 *****

While the overall experience of the hotel was very favorable - clean, comfortable and good customer service throughout my visit, it was somewhat tainted by elevators that were very noisy and somewhat jerked in their movement. I heard comments from other guests about whether the elevators are safe to use or not.

This is a great hotel that is conveniently located, in a good area with lots of retail/dining opportunities.  Service was good, and the rooms are spacious, clean, and new.  Great walk-in shower and all the kitchen amenities needed.  Good breakfast, but could use a few more options/selections.

This a new-ish property sited across the street from a major shopping center and minutes away from beaches and freeway access. The rooms are spacious and the ADA roll in showers exceptionally well designed. While most hotels have retrofits or requirement meeting designs, this rooms is well laid out with insight to wheel chair users. Of many dozens of properties we have stayed in hats off to Marriott architects for their thoughtfulness. Rooms are clean and reasonably appointed. Beds were comfortable. Don't understand why maid service waits until late in the afternoon to service room only when directly requested - requiring us to leave the room despite having been out of the room all day and returning to wet towels at 4:30 pm. Breakfast was okay but can't understand why staff

Was here for business for 3 days.  The hotel is recently renovated so most things are new and fresh.  Great location in the Huntington Beach area and easy to get around without using the 405!   Beds were great and the rooms were clean. The lobby  bench seating could use a bit of cleaning. There is no hotel restaurant but plenty of choices around the location and at the beach .  About 10 minute drive to Huntington Beach Pier
Manager Response: Dear June E,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent stay experience. We value and appreciate your feedback as it helps us to focus on what is important to our guests. We're happy to read that you enjoyed your visit as we are always aiming to achieve excellence. We will continue our pursuit to seek ways to enhance our guest experience and the amenities offered to our guests. Once again, thank you for your valuable feedback. We look forward to serving you whenever your travels bring you back to the Huntington Beach area.   Best regards,  Michael Flowers Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is a very nice hotel that is brand new all around. The rooms are as clean and modern as they get. I was very impressed with everything about the property from the free suckers at the front desk to the awesome rooftop lounging area. I would recommend to anyone that is in the area for either family or business travel. Breakfast was also well kept and had many different options to choose from. Very happy with my visit and I will be returning soon :)

I checked in late in the evening on Aug. 31st. After using the restroom the toilet would not stop running. It ran all night resulting in a less than restful sleep. The following morning I stopped at the front desk and explained the problem with the toilet. It was 7:30 AM and I told the clerk I'd be gone all day and they could access the room at anytime. I got back to the hotel at approximately 9:30 PM and in 14 hours nobody bothered to fix the toilet. Housekeeping didn't even ask for somebody to check it out and they had to have heard it when they cleaned. I promptly called the front desk where I was informed that the clerk was the only one working and he'd get back to me. Almost an hour later I called again and now he informed me that there was no maintenance staff to help and
Manager Response: Dear jmcat14,  Thank you for sharing your comments as your feedback is essential in our continuous efforts to improve our service standards.   I am reaching out to you to apologize that your stay was not up to expectations, and your experience was not excellent. This is certainly not the usual high standard of service we provide at the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach. I have spoken with my Front Desk Team to ensure this does not happen again. I have also had my maintenance team look at the toilet in your room to make sure it is functioning properly. We will be reaching out to you directly to discuss the charges you are seeing on your receipt.   Once again, I would like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay, and I sincerely hope you will give us another opportunity in the future. It is our passion to make sure every single guest has an excellent experience when staying with us. Thank you again for provide us with this helpful feedback so we can achieve this goal.  Sincerely,  Patrick Graves General Manager SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach

Summary: Overall everything was great and new about the hotel. The patio on the second floor was cool to hang out outside and play some games. The continental breakfast was very large and good. Our room was nice and comfortable. Very modern. The only downside was no pool.

This is a very nice hotel. Well appointed and very clean rooms. Every staff member, from the front desk to the cleaning crew, has been responsive, friendly and very helpful.  This location is convenient for visiting the Beach cities and Disneyland. Twenty minutes from Long Beach or John Wayne airports. We'll stay here again.

Stayed for 3 nights, sleep quality was good, beds still seem new and thats a good thing. Personnel seemed friendly and professional, the second floor patio is a nice touch, we stayed on the 4th floor for maximum quietness with the modern construction having thin walls to save money I suppose. Only caveat is the front desk was a little hit/miss, from Platinum status never being acknowledged to printers working intermittently, to seeing no on at the front desk at times, the entire stay was nice, and what i expect at Springhill Suites properties but nothing in the end to earn a 5th star, and it was not a busy time, not sure how they hold up under heavy load of guests.

Checked in and the desk manager was very friendly and helpful as was the entire staff . Beautiful room with plenty of space , very clean and comfortable . Was nice having a bar at the hotel to enjoy a drink and wind down after the long drive .  Complimentary breakfast was good and dining area was very clean.  Very happy with our stay.

Very nice hotel close to the 405. Room (and common areas) show no sign of wear and tear. Room was well layed  out with a desk, couch, mini fridge, micro and large flat screen. Only complaint would be standard size toilet. After batting close to 100 why not put in taller stools? Every employee I encountered was friendly. Common area included lots of various seating and tables plus a small beer and wine bar for those so inclined. The free breakfast was short on hot items (no potatoes or waffles) but did have top quality muffins and mini scones. Even with a large group of surfers from France breakfast seating was no problem. Great place for extended stays.

Summary Heading: Nothing flashy, but a solid stay
Summary: This hotel looked really nice from the photos, and for the most part it lived up to expectations.  I think a couple of places where it fell short in my mind, were, A) Location - It wasn't super close to anything we were here to see, but was a decent midway point between the beaches and downtown Anaheim. B) Breakfast was a bit underwhelming, but it was included, so you can't complain too much. We had trouble with some of the lights in our room, and while the room runs off the efficiency card system, some of the lights just wouldn't come on in general.   The bed was comfortable and I slept well on it.  The room is laid out nicely, with a good bit of room to stretch out.  I'm not crazy about the position of the TV, but we barely used it.  Parking is $10 per day, but it seems any LA

I rarely give a 5 star rating but this hotel was beautiful and perfect for my family of 4 adults and 1 teen. The beds were soft, the room perfect and clean, breakfast was good and the hostess at the counter was polite and informative. I will definitely be coming back to this hotel. Also, it very close to huntington beach.

Summary Heading: Front desk fellas were the very best!!!
Summary: I met Michael at the front desk when I checked in they was super helpful took the time and was patient about a lot of questions and things we had to talk about then I had the pleasure of asking them for some help with finding a few places to go and he took the time out he had people at the front desk and yet people on the phone and he just stopped to help me.Then when I got back to the room Bobby was on duty and I had a big problem my door wouldn’t lock it’s 2 o’clock in the morning Bobby took the time to come up and work with us help us figure it out and just try and make it work to try and move us whatever it took to get it done and he was very helpful and he seemed like he really cared thumbs up to Bobby!!!

Summary Heading: Great location!  The sleeper/trundle bed is a winner!
Summary: We stayed here the night before leaving on a cruise.  A mall with numerous family friendly food options is across the street.  The couch has a trundle underneath, so it was a great option for our 2 grandsons.  Breakfast options were varied and all ages found something good to eat.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.

Me and my girlfriend stayed at SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach for Labor Day weekend. The hotel is fairly new in a good location about a 10 minute drive to the beach. There is plenty of shopping and restaurants in the immediate area, easy highway access about a 30-40 minute drive into LA. The hotel room had a odd layout with the bathroom door directly in front of the bed and tv off to the side. Breakfast is served in the mornings nothing special but it’ll do the job help save a few dollars. Laundry room onsite, decent workout room. Overall it’s a nice hotel for a good price, I’d recommend staying there if you don’t want to spend a lot of money and don’t want to be in the hustle and bustle of LA.

Room 423 Room was very clean. Room had small living room area with sofa, ottoman, desk, chair, mini-frig, and microwave. TV positioned halfway between living room area and bedroom area. TV was difficult to use and even harder to see from either area. Bedroom had 2 queen beds, huge walk-in closet with extra blankets, iron/board. Bathroom had shower (no tub), sink/vanity, toilet with a sliding barn door. No locking mechanism. AC unit was next to the window. AC worked great and was pretty quiet too.   Lobby area has lots of seating areas, TV’s, and a bar that’s open 4pm-11pm. There’s a small seating area away from the bar near the elevators. Small fitness room as well. Parking is $10.   Hotel is located in a nice safe area with several large shopping centers surrounding it.

Summary Heading: Nice but still missing a little
Summary: First, keep in mind that SpringHill suites are constructed cheaper than Marriott hotels. Therefore you will hear a lot more outside noise (traffic, babies crying in the next room, people walking in the room above, etc.). Also, SpringHill suites are all designed so that the bathroom door is translucent, meaning that if anyone uses the bathroom, the light floods the bedroom. Poor design--it should be opaque or solid. Very annoying. That being said, this was a nice hotel. The lobby is exceptional, and the morning breakfast was always kept refreshed. Lots of room to sit and relax.The one problem with the stay was that housekeeping did not clean the room. It took the third day with me talking to the manager before I got any room service to replace towels and empty trash. Not sure
Manager Response: Hello Montgomery L,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. It really does help us with our number one goal of always working to make our hotel better. I apologize that you were not satisfied with your stay and that we did not provide you with the excellent experience I know you expect from Marriott hotels. I also want to assure you that I am personally looking into other lighting options for our bathrooms to resolve the issue you had with our bathroom doors. I have also discussed the issues you mentioned with my Housekeeping Team. Again, I want to thank you for mentioning this, as your feedback does help us make changes to improve the quality of our Guest's experience while staying at our hotel. I do hope you will return in the future and find your stay to be excellent. My staff and I will be working in the meantime to find new ways to improve using your feedback.   Thank You,  Patrick Graves General Manager SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach

Summary: We stayed here for one night after staying at a Hampton Inn in San Clemente.  This was a very nice hotel and very comfortable.  It was welcome after our other stay as the accommodations were much better.  Both were suites.  The food wasn't as good as the Hampton, but the staff was all over keeping it stocked.  The eggs and sausage were bland.  It was a holiday weekend so maybe it would be better when they have more time to cook it. It just needs some seasoning.

We stayed for 1 night a few months back and had a great experience. The room was nicely renovated, very clean and spacious. We didn't need much service since we got what we need therefore couldn't evaluate this part. We will stay here again when we revisit the area.

Summary Heading: Very new and clean hotel with and great location for visiting little Saigon.
Summary: Stayed here in June for our vacation to LA/OC area, this hotel was perfect for our trip, the staff were very friendly and the rooms were nice and clean.  The hotel location is close to shopping and highway access and has plenty of parking.  We think this hotel is very family friendly.  We will definitely be staying here next time for our trip to Disneyland with our kids

Our family of six stayed here for one night before flying out of the Long Beach airport. The hotel is in excellent condition. There is lots of room to stretch out. A small quaint lobby bar and a lovely terrace. It’s super convenient to major points of interest in the OC. With a large family we have a tough time finding rooms large enough but this was just right. Dean checked us in and was super friendly. We would definitely stay here again!

I was in Huntington Beach for a softball tournament the weekend before the July 4th holiday.  I had delayed booking my hotel due to high rates in the area.  I called the Springhill and explained that I was a Marriott Platinum and was there to umpire the tournament.  I spoke with Breanna who was a doll and she gave me a lower rate so that I could stay there.  I also spoke with David Flowers who was the manager on duty and he was very nice as well.  As usual, I will list the hotel as pros and cons:  PROS:   Excellent staff as previously discussed  Great location, near the freeway, but quiet with a large shopping area across the street with tons of restaurants, a Whole Foods, a Costco and a movie theatre.  Very well appointed rooms, separate living area, refrigerator, microwave.

We stayed 3 days. Breana checked us in and she was friendly and helpful with information about the area and places to go. The hotel is in a prime location near shopping and only a short  few miles to the beach just down Beach Blvd. There are coffee shops, boutiques, as well as a Whole Foods Market just across the street. An easy walk across. Know before you go there is no pool on the property. However they do have a really nice gym and great meeting and sitting areas. Good place to meet up with family or friends when in town.

Check in was perfect, the room was perfect, the amenities were great.  There is no pool which I miss.  BUT---There is a great bar! and Exercise room. Good location close to the freeway but not noisy.   Short drive to the beach if you want to see or visit the ocean. The hotel has an upbeat feel and I totally enjoyed myself. There ARE hair dryers in the room - the hair dryer is under the sink in the bathroom and you must struggle to open the door below the sink.  I had a tough time finding the dryer and a very difficult time getting the door open. - Do Not Despair!  Keep trying.  Housekeeping could pay more attention to detail.  They left old coffee cups and drink cups in the room. Not a totally big deal but I thought they should have been tossed.

I stayed one night. The bathroom smelled like used cleaning solution that had been used from cleaning 5 bathrooms. For  "modern place" there is no central a/c. Theres that motel 6 loud a/c attached to the outside. When calling for more amenities (i.e. soap), I was told to come downstairs and pick it up and they could not bring it up. For an apparently 4 star plus hotel, I felt like i was at the Motel 6.
Manager Response: Dear dhancali,  Thank you for sharing your comments as your feedback is essential in our continuous efforts to improve our service standards.   I am reaching out to you to apologize that your stay was not up to expectations, and your experience was not excellent. This is certainly not the usual high standard of service we provide at the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach. Cleanliness is extremely important to us here, but we also understand when you walk into your room you should not have to be inconvenienced by the smell of cleaning solution. I have spoken with my Housekeeping team about our cleaning process to ensure this does not happen again. I have also had my maintenance team look at the AC in your room to make sure it is functioning properly.  Once again, I would like to apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay, and I sincerely hope you will give us another opportunity in the future. It is our passion to make sure every single guest has an excellent experience when staying with us. Thank you again for provide us with this helpful feedback so we can achieve this goal.  Sincerely,  Patrick Graves General Manager SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach

Summary: This is a newly built place.  It is clean and has modern West Elm furniture.   It's self parking $10 a night, and self luggage cart, but that's ok.  Check-In was relatively fast.   Your key must stay inside the energy insert to power your room, so make sure to grab it when you go. The design of their room is a little weird.  The bathroom has a frosted glass door that doesn't lock and it sits front and center across from the beds, and you hear it all.  I had to buzz for a clean blanket on our first night.  Not much sleep was had, as the walls are thin and parties seemed to be surrounding us. When a neighboring door would slam, it seemed to shake our headboard.    Breakfast is eggs, waffle, oatmeal, cereal, pastries, cafeteria type quality, but again free so hard to complain, self
Manager Response: Katerina,  Thank you for sharing your valuable feedback with us as we strive to be excellent at all times. I want to apologize that your stay in regards to our service and amenities fell short of expectations. Your concern about the channel selection for kids has been shared with the rest of my management team and we will look into expanding our selection for kids. I have also shared your feedback in regards to the room with our design team. With our market, we do accept credit/debit cards in addition to cash or room charge, so I will work on retraining staff to ensure we properly inform guests of their options when wanting to purchase snacks, drinks, or toiletries from our market. Again, I sincerely apologize that we fell short of excellent on your stay with us and I hope that next time you are in the area, you choose to give us a chance to change any negative impressions you have of the hotel.

Summary: The rooms are nice and new and beds are comfortable. With that said, there is no pool, the gym is tiny and no hair dryers in the rooms. house keeping didn't show up until after 4 PM to clean the room. We had to leave our room after a long day of class, just so house keeping could clean.   There is a very nice rooftop deck on the 2nd floor with lawn games, heaters and lounge chairs. The front desk staff closed the deck at 10 every night but there is no sign with any sort of hours on it for the deck area so we got kicked out as soon as we got settled in. There is nothing else to do so it doesn't make much sense to close the deck.  If you have no kids and are staying one night to sleep or if you don't want to do anything but stay in your room while you are at this hotel, it would
Manager Response: Dear Juliane M,  Thank you sharing your experience with regard to the service and comfort of your stay. I truly appreciate your constructive feedback and I am sorry to see that all was not perfect on this occasion. Please accept my sincerest apologies as this is not the Springhill Marriott service of excellence which we aim to achieve. Please be assured that every point of your comments have been noted and will be addressed with the team to be used as an opportunity to train and change procedures or practices that need improving. Our outdoor terrace is closed by 10pm every night out of consideration for our guests that occupy the many rooms outside of the common area. We sincerely hope to have the opportunity in welcoming you back to the property again in the not too distant future and we thank you for your business.  Warmest regards,

Summary: This hotel was great!! I hosted my Wedding guests at this hotel and everyone was pleased. The rooms were clean, spacious, and modern. I the only thing was I wish they had a pool other than that I would definitely stay here again. The staff were friendly and the breakfast bar area wasn't half bad either.

We arrived around 11am and the room was not ready so we continued our agenda to Disneyland and returned 11pm.  When we were back, to our surprise, the room type (2 x Queen) we reserved earlier was not arranged and since the whole property was sold out, we were left with no choice but to put up in a room far away from lift and facing the highway. The night was not really pleasant  due to unceasing road noise and some drunk pple yelling in the car park post wedding event.  The next morning, we went to David and he was able to arrange the desired room for us and the whole experience took a turn and ended quite well.  The breakfast was not bad with good variety to choose from.   If there is anything to pick on, it would be the $10 parking charge. It seems that charging parking is a
Manager Response: Dear alexgohkw,  Thank you for taking your time to share the details of your recent stay with us on TripAdvisor.  I regret to learn that you left our hotel less than satisfied and encountered  desired room type issues during your check-in. I'm glad to hear that David was able to assist and get you what your requested. Your feedback is very important to us as it help's us to improve our services and guest experience. Despite that, I am grateful to know that you enjoyed our extensive breakfast selection and the rest of your time on property. Once again, thank you for sharing your feedback with us. I sincerely hope that we would have the opportunity in welcoming you back again.  Best regards,

Summary: Pur family of 7 stayed for 5 days!! The first night our lil one threw up and it was terrible... but the sweet gal at the front switched our rooms in a jippy. Rooms were all clean. All workers were helpful and kind! Breakfast has many choices and kids were excited everyday for a delicious meal. Kids also loved the daily free suckers and the outside play area on the second floor. When we checked out the lady from the firdt night remebered us and asked us how the lik guy was doing. About a 20 min DRIVE to the beach ÷). We loved it!!   Sorry ckeaning ladies for all the sand in the showers... they never seem to complain <3.

This place is pretty much as expected. Front desk did an excellent job of helping me find a room that really fit my preferences. Thank you. I like the location of this hotel if you have business in Orange County.

Great choice for a stay in HB.close to good amenities like restaurants,shops,cinema etc.that you can walk too. The rooms are new,well laid out and a good size with comfortable beds,might be wise to ask for a room at the back as there could be noise from the highway at the front. The staff are friendly,professional and give the place a welcoming feel.  David on reception was great,very helpful and a real ambassador for the hotel. Well equipped gym,laundry facilities and the free continental breakfast was good. It is a 30 minute drive to the beach,we found the location be be a very good base for the area and would have no hesitation in recommending this good value,comfortable and friendly hotel.

New! New furnishings, fixtures, carpets. The place was immaculate and everything was new. The rooms as greater and accommodated our entire family of six. The breakfast was terrific and included everything you could want. Great stay. Perfect for families.

This is a great location for visiting the Huntington Beach area and even Disneyland. It is brand new and the staff was very professional and helpful. Breakfast was the usual fare, but was well stocked throughout the morning. It's also right off the 405 freeway and easy access. It has Marriott quality without having to drive to Costa Mesa.

This hotel was sold as near beach, but in reality it is not.  We had to drive 20-30 min to beach in traffic each way and the hotel has no pool.  It was in a sketch area near hiway, not resort location at all.  It was full of people on business, so may be good for that but not vacation or beach.  Noise from interstate all night.  Bathroom has glass door so every time somebody uses at night, lights up whole room, really poor layout.  Bathroom door was directly in front of the 3 beds, where tv should have been on wall, and no pull out couch, it was a trundle that was hard to get out and you stub your toes on sharp edges at night since its on floor.  Also who wants to sleep on a hotel floor, its should be an elevated sofa bed, not a trundle that sits on floor, gross!  I usually like
Manager Response: Dear Foreste1,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your visit to the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach. We truly value your feedback and I can assure you that your input is being discussed among our management team. I want to apologize if there was any confusion on where our hotel was located. I also want to apologize that the new SpringHill Suites design does not meet your expectations. It is our hope that each and every guest enjoys our larger than normal rooms with a separate work and living spaces, access to Netflix and Hulu and a modern upscale design. We have passed on your feedback to the Marriott design team. Thank you again for giving us your feedback and helping us improve. We certainly hope this encounter does not deter you from future visits to the Huntington Beach area and would be so grateful for another opportunity to win you over with the authentic hospitality culture the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach staff is known for.   Best regards,

Summary: This place is literally brand new, the place has no issues. Love the designs within the hotel and also love the fact that its right in a great place, this is right next to everything you need. The staff are friendly and helpful, the only thing I had an issue with was the noise above me. Make sure to book the top floor as I heard a heavy footed person above  me. Also the tv and rooms are smart friendly so Netflixand USB's are everywhere.

Good location. Close enough to Disney. Very close to Huntington Beach. Lots of places to eat around here. Rooms were nice and big. Breakfast was good.  great base for a family on vacation. Workout room was nice. Check in staff was great. The only thing I didn’t like was the parking fee. They waived it when I said that was not explained to me. However that was minor.

Summary Heading: Nice modern hotel, large suite style rooms
Summary: This is a relatively new property, large spacious rooms with modern contemporary amenities. Excellent staff, check in was quick. Good location next to highways. I did not use the pool or gym.    The only issue is that the actual address is a challenge for GPS programs or Google Maps, I used Uber twice during my stay and both times the drivers were at an adjacent property on the back road. Keep this in mind if you want to avoid this hassle.

Summary Heading: Pleasant Stay at a simple yet Beautiful Hotel
Summary: My good experience with this hotel started before I even arrived. I got notification at least a few hours before I was suppose to check in that, that my room was ready. I enjoyed my stay here. It is a beautiful modern hotel in a good location. Everything is still new and fresh. The price was very reasonable. Parking is only $10. The rooms and bathroom were a good size. The bed was very comfortable. There are a microwave and mini fridge in the room. The tv was equipped with internet TV. It made it super easy to sign in to your netflix, hulu, youtube, etc. There were plenty of outlet to charge devices, even if you only had the USB. There is this nice terrace on the second floor, where you can relax and enjoy the view or play some life-size games (connect 4, Jenga, foosball). Wi-fi

Nice and new hotel, very clean. Sean at the front desk was very friendly and helpful checking me in. Breakfast in the morning was good. I didn’t give a 5 star review because our shower door didn’t close tightly (and the door handle was loose) so the water would get all over the bathroom floor. I explained the issue to the front desk and requested extra floor towels later in the evening and the front desk associate didn’t seem concerned about the leaky shower door. We were only staying for 2 nights so I didn’t bother trying to switch rooms. Also, parking is $10/day.
Manager Response: Dear rlm_travlers,  Thank you for sharing your comments as your valuable feedback is essential in our continuous efforts to improve our service standards. We are disappointed to hear that our staff did not meet your expectations when being informed about the shower door. I would like to extend our most sincere apologies for the frustration that this has caused. We are sorry for the shortfalls in service that you experienced and would like to assure you that we will continue to conduct the necessary training to ensure that our guests receive the positive and memorable hotel experiences that we are committed to deliver. We hope you will give us an opportunity to recover your impression of the hotel and look forward to welcoming you again.   Best regards,

Summary: The hotel is very new, with West Elm furnishings. It’s clean and modern... and best of all, the bed was very comfortable. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. I would definitely recommend this location -comparable to a higher end Marriott at a much more affordable rate. FWIW, I spend about 20 nights per year in Marriott properties.

Love the remodeled modern look of the Springhill Suites. This is the second one we’ve stayed in this year and it didn’t disappoint.   Bed is comfy. Large TV. Oversized couch. Free breakfast.   Parking is $10/day. Convenient location across the street from Shopping, Whole Foods, Costco, restaurants.   If you in town for a short stay it would be better to Uber around. Car rental rates are pricey with all the extra CA fees and taxes.   Located only 10 minutes from the airport.
Manager Response: Dear Utah-Indy,  Thank you for sharing this review with us on TripAdvisor. We are delighted that you had an overall positive experience at our newly opened property. We appreciate your time in sharing this review and hope to welcome you back again soon.  Best regards,

Summary: I was in town for a softball tournament so I chose this hotel for its proximity to the softball fields at the Huntington Beach Complex.  I was pleasantly surprised to arrive and find shopping and restaurants across the street including a Whole Foods Market.   Room: I had requested a double room, but we were checking in early and there were no rooms available so I opted for a King. The room was separated into a living/sleeping area by a desk. There was a very large oversized couch. There was a refrigerator and microwave. The TV was huge and offered Netflix so you could log onto account and access movies. The room was very comfortable.   Hotel Grounds:  The hotel serves a complimentary breakfast every morning. Breakfast is served in a tight space and can imagine on busy mornings
Manager Response: Dear Melstone05,  Thank you for sharing this review with us on TripAdvisor. We are delighted that you enjoy the property when in the Huntington Beach area. We strive to create memorable hotel experiences for our guests and are heartened by your feedback. We certainly look forward to welcome you back.   Best regards,

Summary: Stayed here with my elderly Mother and could not have been more pleased. The hotel was extremely busy but the employees all had positive attitudes and a can do spirit. I found our room to be very comfortable, well appointed and quite. Breakfast was a plus and the choices were ample.
Manager Response: Dear Fairviewmanor,  Thank you for sharing this review with us on TripAdvisor. We are delighted that you had an overall positive experience and enjoyed the comfort of your room and the amenities of the hotel. Should your travels bring you back to Huntington Beach, we hope to welcome you back soon.  Best regards,

Summary: Great hotel. Beautiful rooms and recreational areas. There is a bar and lounge where you can watch sport etc. this is where breakfast is located with everything you could want in the morning. The drive took about a 10 minutes from the Huntington Beach Pier. It was great to stay here as there is an outdoor mall across the road with shops and eating venues. Also a whole foods is located in this mall. I really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to write this generous review of us on Tripadvisor. Our vision is to create memorable hotel experiences for our guests and we are delighted that you enjoyed the friendly and helpful service by our associates and had a positive stay. We certainly look forward to welcoming you back for another wonderful experience.   Best regards,

Summary: Nice place on our way to visit family in San Diego from LA, clean comfortable spacious rooms, breakfast, friendly staff, near LA, boardwalks and pier not far away. Snacks and drinks sold in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear 283rubinf,  Thank you so much for staying with us. I am glad that we enhanced your overall visit and our team provided you with top notch hospitality. We look forward to assisting you again when your travels bring you back to the Huntington Beach area.   Kind Regards,

Summary: After 6 weeks in USA we look for a Springhill Suites wherever we go. We have 2 teenagers so the extra trundle/sofa bed in a separated Lounge area is always welcome. Large room with 3 queen beds, large bathroom and large walk in cupboard. Lobby is lovely. New hotel opposite an ok mall with cinemas and a Whole Foods.
Manager Response: Dear Charlotte T.  Thank you for sharing this review with us on TripAdvisor. We are delighted that you had an overall positive experience and appreciated the convenient location of the hotel. As we strive to create memorable hotel experiences for our guests, we are also glad that you enjoyed the friendly, professional and welcoming service that we are committed to deliver. We certainly look forward to welcoming you back soon.   Best regards,

Summary Heading: noisy!!!!! Walls paper thin - could not sleep
Summary: The floors must be paper thin because the people upstairs pounding the floor and have kid running since 8:30 last night.  They told me quiet hours 9-8.  I knew this would happen. Kid up running at 6!!! Front desk said walls just thin. She said she would call but they just got louder! Now I’m up and the kid is running around! The day is ruined! What a terrible night!!!! Also glitch in system, they knocked st 11:45 with housekeeping request that popped up then even though my checkin was much earlier! No pool! Who ever went to a marriot without a pool? We got here early and kids wanted hot tub. I guess I never read the amenities because marriot always had pools. The place is new and looks gorgeous!
Manager Response: Dear Elana K.  Thank you for sharing your comments as your feedback is essential in our continuous efforts to improve our service standards.   We are disappointed to hear that your stay was not up to expectations, and your experience was less than satisfactory. We sincerely apologize as this is certainly not the usual high standard we offer at the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach. We have shared your feedback with our teams for improvement.  Once again, we would like to apologize for the disappointment you experienced during your stay, and while we understand that you may not return to Springhill Huntington Beach again in the near future, we sincerely hope you will give us another opportunity to recover your impression of the hotel should the opportunity arise.  Best regards,

Summary: This is always our “go-to” hotel when we are in the area. Always meets our expectations and beyond. We’ve been so frequently this past 6 months, I think most of the staff recognizes our faces by this point. Not sure if that’s a good thing or a bad thing. Haha. Regardless, this hotel is always super clean, comfortable, stylish and up to date decor. Definitely has become my husbands very favorite hotel chain because of this particular hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Sara S.  Thank you for your five star rating and for selecting the Springhill Suites Huntington Beach. We truly appreciate your kind and gracious comments regarding the team and hotel. We also appreciate being you go-to hotel in the area. We look forward to seeing you back soon.  Safe travels,

Summary Heading: Very nice stay, will definitely go back
Summary: I stayed here for 5 nights the week of Thanksgiving.  The hotel is very new clean and accommodating.  They have free breakfast every day which was a big perk and have smart TVs in the room so the one night my husband and I stayed in we were able to watch Netflix.  It is important to keep in mind that it is not close to the beach though so if you are planning to stay there definitely rent a car.  The cost is only $10 a day which to the other hotels were like $50 a day.  I definitely will stay here when I return.  Like my friend had said you cant ever really go wrong with a Mariott.

The hotel is new and modern. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the free breakfast and was impressed to see the manager refilling the coffee, emptying the trash, and just making sure the guests had everything they needed. The location is very convenient with many dining and shopping options within walking distance.

Recently stayed at his hotel and loved it!  Location was very convenient to activities and shops.  Hotel is very clean and stylish and has spacious guest rooms.  Ours had a lit walk-in closet which came in handy for changing without waking others sleeping in the room.  Highly recommend this hotel - friendly and accommodating staff, free wifi and breakfast!  Only areas of improvement I'd recommend is to have a waffle maker and eliminate the $10 daily parking fee.
Manager Response: Dear Elizabethbc7797wx,  Thank you so much for staying with us and your kind compliments on our hotel. I am happy to hear that we enhanced your overall experience during your time in Huntington Beach. We look forward to another opportunity to assist you again when your travels return you back to the area. Thank you again for being a valued guest.  Best regards,

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights for my sisters wedding. It is a great hotel, brand new, wonderful staff. Breakfast was decent, having a full bar was a bonus. Located across the street from a shopping center with lots of great restaurants. Loved having the small frig, microwave and coffee maker. They took really good care of us and the whole bridal party. Thank you!!
Manager Response: Dear Hhogelund,  Thank you for sharing your positive experience with our hotel and our TripAdvisor community. We want to thank you for choosing our hotel as your home away from home and look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: Recently stayed here for a work trip; was actually supposed to be a backup reservation as it was quite far from the convention center (in Long Beach) but everything was sold out and I was part of a staff block that got moved to this location. Lucky for us, it's a great new property.  Room: spacious for newer hotels, has a large desk to work at, bed was comfortable, very clean, bathroom was nice. Couple of things I didn't like though was the lack of a rack for your suitcase inside the closet, and also did not have a safe inside the room.  Hotel Property: Lobby was bright and clean. Staff was very friendly, and actually remembered & greeted me by name after a couple days. Breakfast every morning was complimentary and had good healthy options (fresh fruit, eggs, greek yogurt, multi
Manager Response: Dear clin7186,  Thank you so much for staying with us, it was a pleasure to host you during your time in the Huntington Beach area. I am happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations and we look forward to assisting you again when your travels return you to the area.   best regards,

Summary Heading: This is as good as it gets.
Summary: We selected the SpringHill  Suites at Huntington Beach for its great location.  For the next 6 days the experience was one of the best we have had while traveling.  The staff is first class, can't say enough about the attention they gave us.  Having a bar was a surprising plus for us and the bar service was also first class. Do yourself a favor and stay at this location.
Manager Response: Dear RioSnook,  Thank you so much for staying with us. I am happy to hear that you found your time with us comfortable, clean and memorable. We do our best to exceed our guest expectation and it sound like we did just that. From all of us here at SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach we hope to have another opportunity to assist you with accommodation the next time that you return to the area. Thank you again for staying with us.  best regards,

Summary Heading: Sensational new hotel that treats you like royalty!
Summary: We needed one night stay for a wedding and booked this one because it’s brand new! So happy w the choice. Staff is great and professional. Front desk is super welcoming and friendly. I want to do a shoutout for Sharon at the front desk. She was so awesome, she went out of her way and always had a smile on her face. Thank you! Room was super comfortable and roomy! Breakfast was so so but hey, Whole Foods is just across the street! If you don’t like the free breakfast, cross the street! Loved this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear MLD31,  Thank you for staying with us, it was a pleasure to host you while you were in the Huntington Beach area. Thank you for your compliments on the hotel and staff and we look forward to assisting you on a future stay when you are back in the area.  best regards,

Summary: New hotel, felt like we were the first ones ever in our room. Attractive, modern, clean throughout. Friendly helpful staff, good restaurants and shopping in a very short walking distance, I recommend BJ's; great specials and happy hour deals.
Manager Response: Dear Rock D,  Thank you so much for staying with us. I am glad to see that you enjoyed our newly built hotel and found our location clean and comfortable during your stay. We look forward to assisting you when you are back in the Huntington Beach area and appreciate your feedback.  Kind Regards,  Michael Flowers Assistant General Manager Springhill Suites Huntington Beach Orange County

Summary Heading: New and modern with a few design flaws
Summary: Stayed for a one-night family reunion.  The hotel is in a good location - just off the 405 and across the street from a variety of restaurants and shops. The continental breaksfast was decent enough and the staff was very helpful. The major problems are: - NO pool or jacuzzi - Frosted glass doors leading into the bathroom directly across from the bed. If you or your roommate needs to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, bring a flashlight or expect to wake up the rest of your traveling party.
Manager Response: Dear Alfonzia,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. It really does help us with our number one goal of always working to make our hotel better. I apologize that you were not satisfied with your stay and that we did not provide you with the excellent experience I know you expect from Marriott hotels. Unfortunately we do not have a pool at this location, but we do encourage our guests to enjoy our new 2nd Floor Terrace entertainment area, with plenty of seating to relax and games like Foosball, Bean Bag Toss and Giant Jenga. I also want to assure you that I am personally looking into other lighting options for our bathrooms to resolve the issue you had with our bathroom doors. Again, I want to thank you for mentioning this, as your feedback does help us make changes to improve the quality of our Guest's experience while staying at our hotel. I do hope you will return in the future and find your stay to be excellent. My staff and I will be working in the meantime to find new ways to improve using your feedback.   Thank You,  Patrick Graves General Manager SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach

Summary Heading: Excellent BRAND NEW hotel near beach
Summary: This hotel is a gorgeous property in the Huntington beach area. It is 10 minute drive to the beach. Directly across the street from dining and restaurants. This hotel is new, modern, spacious, clean and has very nice amenities. The hot complimentary breakfast was way better than other hotels I have experienced....it varied each day but included scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, potatoes/home fries, oatmeal, cereal, fresh fruit, pastries, cheeses, coffee, tea, etc. The gym was sufficient. Equipment was clean, new and there was complimentary water and headphones to use. There is also an outdoor/deck/patio space that was quite enjoyable for evenings with a glass of wine or to sit and have coffee in the morning. There is a full bar in the lobby. The outdoor living space has lounge chairs
Manager Response: Dear Sweetbabiet,  Thank you for taking your time to write this generous review of us.  As we strive to create memorable hotel experiences for our guests, our associates are focused on taking care of the needs of our valued guests with highly attentive service and utmost professionalism to ensure your stay is a memorable one. Providing excellent service is at the core of our service commitment to our guests and your kind words will definitely motivate the team to keep up our high standards.  We are glad that we were able to make your visit a memorable one, and look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.  Best regards,  Michael Flowers Assistant General Manager

Summary: The stay was really nice. It's a very modern hotel, TV is smart with Netflix... Suite was very fancy and price reasonable. Bed was also super comfy too! Awesome night! I was there with a coworker for business meetings and he was also very pleased with the room, services and location.
Manager Response: Dear Amandine,  Thank you so much for your feedback on our hotel. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your time here and we hope to see you again soon!  Patrick Graves General Manager SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach

Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights and had a great experience. This hotel was very Modern and Clean. The staff was nice and accommodating. I didn't have a rental car, but I was within a block away from many restaurants and Starbucks which is great. There was also a Mall Bella Terra which had many stores and Whole Foods. I will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Lynette,  We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay. We also love our location! We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank You,  Patrick Graves General Manager SpringHill Suites Huntington Beach

Summary: We just checked out of this hotel after at 10 day stay. This hotel is NEW...as in the towels-still-leave-little-fuzzies-all-over-you kind of new. Such a comfortable place to call our temporary home while we got our daughter settled into her first year at Biola University.  Pretty centrally located to just about whatever you want to do while in the area. Beautifully decorated, super friendly and helpful staff. The only hiccups would be the fact that there is very little variation of the complimentary breakfast, although it is good and lots to choose from. There is also very little lighting available in the rooms. But these are minor things. Overall, this is an excellent hotel to stay in...don't hesitate, book now!  It's going to be high in demand very soon.
Manager Response: Dear Sara,  I am so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us! We are always appreciative of feedback from our guests as it really does help us improve our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to let us know your thoughts and I hope we see you again soon.   Patrick Graves General Manager  SpringHill Suites by Marriott Huntington Beach, CA

Summary: I visited Huntington for leisure and I must say I am glad I stayed here. I am a frequent stayer of only Marriots but this time a chose Springhill suites amd I was impressed. The staff was friendly and professional. The building appeared new and I loved the modern design from West Elm. The room was chic and comfortable. Very affordable price for the lovely accomodations. I will definitely stay here again when in Huntington.
Manager Response: Dear BarbS1213,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know your thoughts about our hotel. We are thrilled that you found the staff the be friendly and professional. We hope you will come stay with us again soon!  Patrick Graves General Manager  SpringHill Suites by Marriott Huntington Beach, CA

Summary: My mom booked this hotel for my fiancé and I. She chose it because it just opened and I must say, she made an excellent choice! I found out upon check-in that it literally opened a week ago. The staff was super friendly throughout our entire stay. They were able to accommodate our requests. The decor was very modern and fitting to the area to the point of wanted to purchase some of their artwork. The room was extremely spacious with a parlor area that included a microwave and refrigerator. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Breakfast was good with a decent selection. The location was close to the 405 but not right off the exit so you didn't get the noise. Lots of nearby shopping and restaurants. Overall in a great area of town. We really didn't want to

I recently stayed for 6 nights at the newly opened Springhill Suites by Marriott Hotel on Edinger Avenue in Huntington Beach, Ca. Not only was the hotel brand new and spotless, the location was perfect for beach-goers and sightseers alike. The front desk employees could not have been more helpful, especially Kendall ! Would certainly stay here again and highly recommend!

Brand new hotel with modern decor! Warm greeting upon arrival and can't wait to try out the breakfast in the Am after a workout in the new fitness center! Room equipped w microwave & refrigerator, tile bath and shower flooring, plush bedding and desk in case you have work to complete. Very upscale and clean. Only opened 3 days so I'm happy to be able to give it rave reviews! People at the front are welcoming and there to help if you need anything!
